page.title: 08ALL ABOUT CAWTHORNE PARK.
page.content: One Saturday morning we set off for Cawthorne park. It can be reached by catching the Huddersfield bus from stand 10 in Barnsley bus station. After a 20 minute ride we arrived there. We saw that there was a river flowing through it with decorative bridges and a weir. We walked along beside it and then shared our dinner with the ducks. These are the species of duck we saw: Canada goose, Mallard, Teal and Grebe. We also saw a Black-headed Gull. If anyone ever goes to Cawthorne Park we advise them not to feed the wildfowl because you end up giving them nearly all of it! In the park there is Cannon Hall, it is a very old house.Surrounding the hall are conifers (which keep their leaves ) and deciduous trees ( which shed them), all planted when the hall gardens were landscaped.
